TopicTitle: damn... how can i save edit to revive the dead....

Articles.Content:
i didnt realize my craft is too heavy for one single ML16 chute to land on Kerbin and i killed Bob and Ronald after he'd been to Mun

(his landing ship has only 1 nuclear engine... which gives the ship a less than 1 TWR in atmoshpere and i quick saved at a steep descending trajectory...tried and couldnt regain orbit; the nuclear engine is such a weakling...)

help please....

sigh.... i was so thinking hey... Mun-and-return is so easy; a chute can do the return landing effortlessly... and i didnt even bother putting a decoupler at the lander can....

and then i underestimated the craft's weight....

Edited July 25, 2013 by lammatt

o well... found it...

state=3 means dead

just change it back to state =0
Do you know how can we choose,by editing the persistence file,who will be the applicants?
i guess they are assigned according to the order of the list under the APPLICANT section...(which is almost at the end of the .sfs file)

I have tough the exact same thing.

I were wrong:each time I edited one of the astronaute(changed it to bill because he was killed in a plane crash),the applicant list changed(I think that only the edited astronaute were replaced by another one).
Makes me wonder if you can add custom-named Kerbals to this applicants list.
